class.rdfs:comment: Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity.
class.rdfs:label: MolecularEntity

schema:chemicalRole.rdfs:comment: A role played by the BioChemEntity within a chemical context.
schema:chemicalRole.rdfs:label: chemicalRole

schema:inChI.rdfs:comment: Non-proprietary identifier for molecular entity that can be used in printed and electronic data sources thus enabling easier linking of diverse data compilations.
schema:inChI.rdfs:label: inChI

schema:inChIKey.rdfs:comment: InChIKey is a hashed version of the full InChI (using the SHA-256 algorithm).
schema:inChIKey.rdfs:label: inChIKey

schema:iupacName.rdfs:comment: Systematic method of naming chemical compounds as recommended by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC).
schema:iupacName.rdfs:label: iupacName

schema:molecularFormula.rdfs:comment: The empirical formula is the simplest whole number ratio of all the atoms in a molecule.
schema:molecularFormula.rdfs:label: molecularFormula

schema:molecularWeight.rdfs:comment: This is the molecular weight of the entity being described, not of the parent. Units should be included in the form '<Number> <unit>', for example '12 amu' or as '<QuantitativeValue>.
schema:molecularWeight.rdfs:label: molecularWeight

schema:monoisotopicMolecularWeight.rdfs:comment: The monoisotopic mass is the sum of the masses of the atoms in a molecule using the unbound, ground-state, rest mass of the principal (most abundant) isotope for each element instead of the isotopic average mass. Please include the units in the form '<Number> <unit>', for example '770.230488 g/mol' or as '<QuantitativeValue>.
schema:monoisotopicMolecularWeight.rdfs:label: monoisotopicMolecularWeight

schema:potentialUse.rdfs:comment: Intended use of the BioChemEntity by humans.
schema:potentialUse.rdfs:label: potentialUse

schema:smiles.rdfs:comment: A specification in form of a line notation for describing the structure of chemical species using short ASCII strings.  Double bond stereochemistry \ indicators may need to be escaped in the string in formats where the backslash is an escape character.
schema:smiles.rdfs:label: smiles
